title: Population of Michigan , by race and ethnicity 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Race in the x axis and Number of residents in the y axis.
The Number of residents is highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
The highest Race White alone has 7472757.0 more Number of residents than the lowest Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Race in the x axis and Number of residents in the y axis.
Race White alone has the highest Number of residents and Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone has the lowest Number of residents.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Race in the x axis and Number of residents in the y axis.
The Number of residents is highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
The highest Race White alone has 7472757.0 more Number of residents than the lowest Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
max_summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of residents in each Race on the y axis.
The Number of residents is appeared to be the highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
There is a difference of 7472757.0 between the maximum Race White alone and minimum Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
Number of residents at Race White alone is 7476047.0 , second place is  at 7476047.0, and thirdly is Hispanic or Latino (of any race) at 517381.0.
Considered together, the average Number of residents in all 8 Races is roughly 1249489.38.
Summing up the values of all Races, we get total 9995915.0.
